results.title: The Yearling
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sidney A. Franklin and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: The Yearling is a story of the Baxter family and their struggle to maintain their small farm. Jody, a twelve year old boy, yearns for a pet with whom he can share the last carefree days of his childhood. He adopts an orphaned fawn but their joyous times are tempered when the fawn grows into a yearling and becomes a threat to the family’s meagre crops. Based on Marjorie Kinnen Rawlings’ acclaimed novel.

results.title: The Year of living dangerously
results.creator_credit: McElroy & McElroy, Jim McElroy and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Set in Indonesia during the 1965 civil strife, this adaptation of the of the novel by C.J. Koch, concentrates on a small group of journalists in Jakarta, who are covering the crisis, and the strange three-way relationship between an Australian correspondent, his extraordinary Chinese-Australian cameraman and the woman they both love.

results.title: The Wrong Man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Herbert Coleman and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A tense thriller based on the true story of an honest man mistaken for an armed robber. When Christopher Balestrero (Henry Fonda) decides to borrow money on his wife’s insurance policy to pay urgent debts, a tragic chain of events is set off because the staff of the insurance company believe him to be a man who previously held up their office.

results.title: The World according to Garp
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, George Roy Hill and Robert L. Crawford
results.brief_description: This film version of John Irving’s novel “The World According to Garp” brilliantly captures the quirky spirit of the original story. T.S. Garp is the illegitimate child of unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields. Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp’s outlook on life crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother achieves fame through the publishing of her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Garp remains envious of his fearless mother. Cast includes: Robin Williams, Mary Beth Hurt, Glenn Close and John Lithgow.

results.title: The Woman in the window
results.creator_credit: The Christie Corporation, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Nunnally Johnson and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: In this film noir, one man’s life is turned upside down by an encounter with a stranger. Professor Richard Wanley (Edward G. Robinson), an academic reduced to summer batchelorhood accepts a beautiful woman’s (Joan Bennett) offer of a drink - only to find himself an inadvertent murderer and a pawn in a dreadful roundelay of deception, blackmail, sudden death and suicide. Director Fritz Lang keeps the tension taut, New York sidewalks glistening and the audience guessing. ‘The Woman in the Window’ shows that good and evil are present in all, and that circumstances frequently dictate moral choices. So successful was this movie that Robinson, Lang, leading lady Joan Bennet and baddie Dan Duryea immediately reteamed for ‘Sacrlett Street’. Screenplay by Nunnaly Johnson from the novel ‘Once off guard’ by J. H. Wallis.

results.title: The Wog boy
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Cinemedia, John Brousek, Nick Giannopoulos and Aleksi Vellis
results.brief_description: Steve (Nick Giannopoulos) is an unemployed Greek man who becomes an unwitting scape goat for various political interest groups when he gets branded a dole cheat on a tabloid style current affairs program. His cause gets taken up by the Minister of employment Raelene Beagle- Thorpe (Geraldine Turner), who turns Steve into the poster boy for her campaign, while a romance blossoms between Steve and the Ministers Anglo aid, Celia (Lucy Bell). Anyone who is familiar with Nick Giannopoulos’s phenomenally successful stage show ‘Wogs out of work’, will find more of the same ground covered in ‘The Wog boy’ as the film broadly lampoons various Australian stereotypes about first and second generation migrants being a bunch of dole cheating, bludgers. Whether star Giannopoulos, director Aleksi Vellis and co-writer Chris Anastassiades achieve their aim of defusing these racist representations by mocking them will entirely depend on whether you think the old fashioned racial jokes on parade here are actually funny. Cast includes Vince Colosimo, Abi Tucker, Derryn Hinch, John Barresi, Hung Le. Special edition includes behind-the-scenes featurette.

results.title: The Wizard of Oz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Mervyn LeRoy and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: This 50th Anniversary Commemorative Edition of the “Wizard of Oz” is as it was originally released in 1939, including the Kansas scenes in warm sepia tones. Featuring film clips and reconstructed musical numbers cut from the original film, this beautifully restored technicolour print is a tribute to the popularity of “The Wizard of Oz” with adults and children alike.

results.title: The Witches of Eastwick
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Guber-Peters Company, Neil Canton, Peter Guber and George Miller
results.brief_description: In a sleepy new England town, three women- Alex, Jane and Sukie (Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer) gather each Thursday to drink, lament the lack of eligible bachelors in their neighbourhood, and fanstasize about their dream partner. Enter wealthy and attractive Daryl van Horne (Jack Nicholson) whom they have innocently conjured up; unbeknownst to them he is the devil in disguise. It’s not long before Daryl has slept with Alex, Jane and Sukie and the town gossip starts- spear headed by local busy body Felicia Alden (Veronica Cartwright), who soon has a nasty experience with some cherries. The women begin to suspect they are not dealing with no ordinary man and must combine their reinvigorated female energy to defeat Satan himself in the ultimate battle of the sexes. Based on the book by John Updike.

results.title: The Witches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment, Jim Henson Productions, Mark Shivas and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: When nine year old Luke and his grandmother go for a quiet seaside holiday, they stumble upon a witches’ convention, hosted by the Grand High Witch, (Angelica Huston). When Luke becomes a victim of the witches’ scheme to rid Britain of all its children, by transforming them into mice, he devises a plot with his grandmother to finally rid the world of witches. Based on the book by Roald Dahl.
